channel.title: Australian school maths
channel.description: Recent content on Australian school maths

item.description:
$ \sqrt{xy} = \sqrt{x} \times \sqrt{y} $
$ \sqrt{\dfrac{x}{y}} = \dfrac{\sqrt{x}}{\sqrt{y}} $
$ (\sqrt{x})^2 = \sqrt{x^2} = x \text{ for } x\ge 0 $

$a^m \times a^n = a^{m+n}$
$a^m \div a^n = \dfrac{a^m}{a^n} = a^{m-n}$
$(a^m)^n = a^{m \times n}$
$(ab)^n = a^nb^n$
$\left(\dfrac{a}{b}\right)^n = \dfrac{a^n}{b^n}$
$a^0=1$
$a^{-n}=\dfrac{1}{a^n}$
$\left(\dfrac{a}{b}\right)^{-n} = \left(\dfrac{b}{a}\right)^n$
$a^{\frac{m}{n}} =\sqrt[n]{a^m}$

$\log_a{(xy)} = \log_a{x} + log_a{y}$
$\log_a{\left(\dfrac{x}{y}\right)} = \log_a{x} - log_a{y}$
$\log_a{x^n} = n\log_a{x}$
$\log_a{\left(\dfrac{1}{x}\right)} = -\log_a{x}$
$\log_a{x} = \dfrac{\log_b{x}}{\log_b{a}}$

$ P(E) = \dfrac{n(E)}{n(S)} $
$P(A \cup B) = P(A) + P(B) - P(A \cap B) $
$P(A \cap B) = P(A)P(B)$
$P(\overline{E}) = 1 - P(E)$
$ P(A|B) = \dfrac{P(A \cap B)}{P(B)} \text{, where } P(B) \neq 0 $
$ P(X=x) = \dfrac{1}{n} \text {applies only to uniform proability distributions with n values} $
$ E(X) =\sum xp(x)$
$ E(X) = \mu $
$ \sigma^{2} = Var(X) = \sum(x-\mu)^{2}p(x)$
$ Var(X) = E[(x-\mu)^2]$
$ Var(X) = \sum[x^2p(x)] - \mu^2$
$ Var(X) = E(X^2) - \mu^2$
$ \sigma = \sqrt{Var(X)}$
$ \text{Mean} = \dfrac{\text{Sum of scores}}{\text{Total number of scores}} = \overline{x} = \dfrac{\sum{x}}{n} $
$ \text{The median of n scores is the } \dfrac{n+1}{2} \text{th score} $ $ \text{if n is even the median is the average of the two middle scores to the left and the right of } \dfrac{n+1}{2} $
$ \text{Range = highest score - lowest score} $
$ \text{Interquartile range = Q3 - Q1} $
$\text{An outlier is a score with} $ $ \text { less than } Q1 - 1.5 \times IQR $ $ \text { or more than than } Q3 + 1.5 \times IQR $
$ \overline{x} = \dfrac{\sum fx}{\sum f} $
$P(a < X < b) = P(a \leq X \leq b) \text {(for continuous probability distributions})$
$F(x) = P(X\leq x) = {\Large\int}^x_a f(x)dx \text { (for continuous probability distributions, where f(x) is a probability distribution function defined in the domain [a,b] and F(x) is the cumulative density function})$
$P(X \leq r) = {\Large\int}_a^r f(x)dx$
$P(a \leq X \leq b) = {\Large\int}_a^b f(x)dx$
$f(x) = \dfrac{1}{b-a} \text{ for } a \leq x \leq b \text { (Uniform continuous probability distributions, where f(x) is a probability distribution function defined in the domain [a,b]})$
$z = \dfrac{x-\mu}{\sigma} $
Items on formula sheet are highlighted

$P(A \cap B) = P(A)P(B)$

$ E(X) = \mu $
$ \sigma^{2} = Var(X) = \sum(x-\mu)^{2}p(x)$
$ Var(X) = E[(x-\mu)^2]$
$ Var(X) = \sum[x^2p(x)] - \mu^2$
$ Var(X) = E(X^2) - \mu^2$
$ \sigma = \sqrt{Var(X)}$

$ \text{Interquartile range = Q3 - Q1} $

$P(a < X < b) = P(a \leq X \leq b) \text {(for continuous probability distributions})$
$F(x) = P(X\leq x) = {\Large\int}^x_a f(x)dx \text { (for continuous probability distributions, where f(x) is a probability distribution function defined in the domain [a,b] and F(x) is the cumulative density function})$
$P(X \leq r) = {\Large\int}_a^r f(x)dx$
$P(a \leq X \leq b) = {\Large\int}_a^b f(x)dx$
$f(x) = \dfrac{1}{b-a} \text{ for } a \leq x \leq b \text { (Uniform continuous probability distributions, where f(x) is a probability distribution function defined in the domain [a,b]})$
$z = \dfrac{x-\mu}{\sigma} $

$ {\Large\int} f'(x)[f(x)]^n dx = \dfrac{1}{n+1}[f(x)]^{n+1} + c $ $ \text{ where } n \neq -1 $
$ {\Large\int_{a}^{b}} f(x) dx \approx \dfrac{b-a} {2n} {\Large\{} f(a) + f(b) + 2 {\Large[} f(x_1)+...+f(x_{n-1}){\Large ]} {\Large\}}$ $ \text { where } a=x_0 \text{ and } b=x_n $
$ {\Large\int} f'(x)\cos f(x)dx = \sin f(x) + c$
$ {\Large\int} f'(x)\sin f(x)dx = -\cos f(x) + c$
$ {\Large\int} f'(x)\sec^2 f(x)dx = \tan f(x) + c$
$ {\Large\int} f'(x)e^{f(x)}dx = e^{f(x)} + c$
$ {\Large\int} \dfrac{f'(x)}{f(x)}dx = \ln|f(x)| + c$
$ {\Large\int} f'(x)a^{f(x)}dx = \dfrac{a^f(x)}{\ln a} +c$
$ {\Large\int} \dfrac{f'(x)}{(\ln a) f(x)} = \log_{a} |f(x)| + c$
$ {\Large\int}_b^a f(x)dx = F(b)-F(a) \text{, where F(x) is the anti-derivative of f(x)}$
$F'(x) = \dfrac{d}{dx} {\Large\int}_a^x f(t)dt = f(x) \text{ (the Fundamental Therom of Calculus)}$
Items on formula sheet are highlighted
$ {\Large\int} f'(x)[f(x)]^n dx = \dfrac{1}{n+1}[f(x)]^{n+1} + c $ $ \text{ where } n \neq -1 $
$ {\Large\int_{a}^{b}} f(x) dx \approx \dfrac{b-a} {2n} {\Large\{} f(a) + f(b) + 2 {\Large[} f(x_1)+...+f(x_{n-1}){\Large ]} {\Large\}}$ $ \text { where } a=x_0 \text{ and } b=x_n $
$ {\Large\int} f'(x)\cos f(x)dx = \sin f(x) + c$
$ {\Large\int} f'(x)\sin f(x)dx = -\cos f(x) + c$
$ {\Large\int} f'(x)\sec^2 f(x)dx = \tan f(x) + c$
$ {\Large\int} f'(x)e^{f(x)}dx = e^{f(x)} + c$
$ {\Large\int} \dfrac{f'(x)}{f(x)}dx = \ln|f(x)| + c$
$ {\Large\int} f'(x)a^{f(x)}dx = \dfrac{a^f(x)}{\ln a} +c$
$ {\Large\int} \dfrac{f'(x)}{(\ln a) f(x)} = \log_{a} |f(x)| + c$
$ {\Large\int}_b^a f(x)dx = F(b)-F(a) \text{, where F(x) is the anti-derivative of f(x)}$
$F'(x) = \dfrac{d}{dx} {\Large\int}_a^x f(t)dt = f(x) \text{ (the Fundamental Therom of Calculus)}$
Items where proofs required are highlighted
$ {\Large\int} f'(x)[f(x)]^n dx = \dfrac{1}{n+1}[f(x)]^{n+1} + c $ $ \text{ where } n \neq -1 $
$ {\Large\int_{a}^{b}} f(x) dx \approx \dfrac{b-a} {2n} {\Large\{} f(a) + f(b) + 2 {\Large[} f(x_1)+...+f(x_{n-1}){\Large ]} {\Large\}}$ $ \text { where } a=x_0 \text{ and } b=x_n $
$ {\Large\int} f'(x)\cos f(x)dx = \sin f(x) + c$
$ {\Large\int} f'(x)\sin f(x)dx = -\cos f(x) + c$
$ {\Large\int} f'(x)\sec^2 f(x)dx = \tan f(x) + c$
$ {\Large\int} f'(x)e^{f(x)}dx = e^{f(x)} + c$
$ {\Large\int} \dfrac{f'(x)}{f(x)}dx = \ln|f(x)| + c$
$ {\Large\int} f'(x)a^{f(x)}dx = \dfrac{a^f(x)}{\ln a} +c$
$ {\Large\int} \dfrac{f'(x)}{(\ln a) f(x)} = \log_{a} |f(x)| + c$
$ {\Large\int}_b^a f(x)dx = F(b)-F(a) \text{, where F(x) is the anti-derivative of f(x)}$
$F'(x) = \dfrac{d}{dx} {\Large\int}_a^x f(t)dt = f(x) \text{ (the Fundamental Therom of Calculus)}$

$A = P(1+r)^n$
$ T_n = T_{n-1} + d $
$T_n = a + (n-1)d$
$S_n = \dfrac{n}{2}[2a + (n-1)d] = \dfrac{n}{2}(a+l)$
$T_n = rT_{n-1}$
$T_n = ar^{n-1}$
$S_n = \dfrac{a(1-r^n)}{1-r} = \dfrac{a(r^n-1)}{r-1},\ \ r \neq 1$
$S=\dfrac{a}{1-r},\ \ |r|<1$
Items on formula sheet are highlighted
$A = P(1+r)^n$
$ T_n = T_{n-1} + d $
$T_n = a + (n-1)d$
$S_n = \dfrac{n}{2}[2a + (n-1)d] = \dfrac{n}{2}(a+l)$
$T_n = rT_{n-1}$
$T_n = ar^{n-1}$
$S_n = \dfrac{a(1-r^n)}{1-r} = \dfrac{a(r^n-1)}{r-1},\ \ r \neq 1$
$S=\dfrac{a}{1-r},\ \ |r|<1$
Items where proofs required are highlighted
$A = P(1+r)^n$
$ T_n = T_{n-1} + d $
$T_n = a + (n-1)d$
$S_n = \dfrac{n}{2}[2a + (n-1)d] = \dfrac{n}{2}(a+l)$
$T_n = rT_{n-1}$
$T_n = ar^{n-1}$
$S_n = \dfrac{a(1-r^n)}{1-r} = \dfrac{a(r^n-1)}{r-1},\ \ r \neq 1$
$S=\dfrac{a}{1-r},\ \ |r|<1$

$\sin A=\dfrac{opp}{hyp}$
$\cos A=\dfrac{adj}{hyp}$
$\tan A=\dfrac{opp}{adj}$
$\dfrac{a}{\sin A} = \dfrac{b}{\sin B} = \dfrac{c}{\sin C} $
$c^2 = a^2 + b^2 - 2ab \cos C$
$A = \dfrac{1}{2} ab \sin C$
$\sin (180^\circ - \theta) = \sin \theta $
$\cos (180 ^\circ - \theta) = - \cos \theta $
$\tan (180 ^\circ - \theta) = - \tan \theta $
$l=r\theta$
$A=\dfrac{1}{2}r^2 \theta$
$\sec A = \dfrac{1}{\cos A}, \cos A \ne 0$
$\text{cosec } A = \dfrac{1}{\sin A}, \sin A \ne 0$
$\cot A = \dfrac{\cos A}{\sin A}, \sin A \ne 0$
$\cos^2 x+\sin^2 x = 1$
$1+\tan^2 x = \sec^2 x$
$\cot^2 x+1 = \text{cosec }^2 x$
$\tan x = \dfrac{\sin x}{\cos x}, cos x \ne 0$
$\sin \theta = \cos (90^{\circ} - \theta)$
$\cos \theta = \sin (90^{\circ} - \theta)$
$\tan \theta = \cot (90^{\circ} - \theta)$
$\cot \theta = \tan (90^{\circ} - \theta)$
$\sec \theta = \text{cosec } (90^{\circ} - \theta)$
$\text{cosec } \theta = \sec (90^{\circ} - \theta)$
Items on formula sheet are highlighted

$\cos \theta = \sin (90^{\circ} - \theta)$
$\tan \theta = \cot (90^{\circ} - \theta)$
$\cot \theta = \tan (90^{\circ} - \theta)$
$\sec \theta = \text{cosec } (90^{\circ} - \theta)$
$\text{cosec } \theta = \sec (90^{\circ} - \theta)$
